p: In the Ayurvedic system of medicines, roots and leaves of the plant were considered phytotherapeutic agents to cure various ailments. Various clinical and preclinical trials exhibited the plant’s potential in curing hepatotoxicity ( 10), neurological disorders ( 11), anxiety ( 12), Parkinson’s disease ( 13), and hyperlipidemia ( 4, 14). The fruits contained considerable amounts of saponins and leaves possessed insect repellent properties ( 15).
